cont.entity_a: Mouse is comfortable to use. Battery life for the mouse is short; rechargeable batteries are advised. Mouse design is not suitable for left-handed use.
cont.entity_b: Mouse feels small and uncomfortable for some users. Battery life is good with power switches on mouse.

cont.entity_a: Keyboard and mouse design is appreciated. Delete/home/end/page up/down keys design is non-standard and takes getting used to. Keyboard resembles a laptop keyboard in size and feel. Mouse design is not suitable for left-handed use.
cont.entity_b: Detachable keypad is a great feature for limited desk space. Spacebar has a tendency to stick, affecting usability.

cont.entity_a: Clock/timer is built into the keyboard. Zoom feature on the side is useful for presentations. Dynamic zoom bar on the keyboard can be finicky and activate unintentionally.
cont.entity_b: Separate calculator feature is convenient. Num pad doubles as a calculator with clock and temperature read-out.

cont.entity_a: Software allows mapping keyboard keys and mouse buttons to different functions.
Battery life for the mouse is short; rechargeable batteries are advised.
cont.entity_b: Battery life is good with power switches on mouse and number pad. MediaPad consumes batteries quickly with no off switch.

cont.entity_a: Installation can be problematic, requiring multiple attempts and can result in startup errors.
cont.entity_b: Setup and installation are quick and easy.

cont.entity_a: Keyboard and mouse are comfortable for extended use.

cont.entity_b: Wireless connection issues with Bluetooth dongle. Wireless device may not work well with certain KVM switches.

cont.entity_a: Keyboard and mouse are durable over time.
Customer service is responsive and helpful.
Function keys work in most software without additional programming.
cont.entity_b: Some keys may not register or repeat, requiring multiple attempts to type.
